get.summary: Triggers an update of system metrics and returns the result in plain text format.
get.description:
# Returns

An `HttpResponse` containing the updated metrics in plain text, or an error message if the
update fails.

200.description: Complete metrics in Prometheus exposition format

get.description:
Note: OpenAPI documentation for these endpoints can be found in the `openapi.rs` file
Returns a list of all available metric names in JSON format.

# Returns

An `HttpResponse` containing a JSON array of metric names.

get.summary: Returns the details of a specific metric in plain text format.
get.description:
# Parameters

- `path`: The name of the metric to retrieve details for.

# Returns

An `HttpResponse` containing the metric details in plain text, or a 404 error if the metric is
not found.

parameters.name: metric_name
parameters.description: Name of the metric to retrieve, e.g. utopia_transactions_total

200.description: Metric details in Prometheus text format

401.description: Unauthorized - missing or invalid API key

403.description: Forbidden - insufficient permissions to access this metric

429.description: Too many requests - rate limit for metrics access exceeded

get.description:
Note: OpenAPI documentation for these endpoints can be found in the `openapi.rs` file
Handles the `/health` endpoint.

Returns an `HttpResponse` with a status of `200 OK` and a body of `"OK"`.

oneOf.description: Use the transaction source account for authorization
Advanced format - provide complete XDR auth entries as base64-encoded strings

ContractSource.description: Represents the source for contract creation

JsonRpcError.description:
JSON-RPC 2.0 Error structure.

Represents an error in a JSON-RPC response.

oneOf.description: Numeric identifier (should not contain fractional parts per spec)

JsonRpcId.description:
Represents a JSON-RPC 2.0 ID value.
According to the spec, the ID can be a String or Number.
When used in Option<JsonRpcId>: Some(id) = actual ID, None = explicit null.

JsonRpcRequest_NetworkRpcRequest.description:
JSON-RPC 2.0 Request structure.

Represents a JSON-RPC request with proper ID handling:
- `Some(JsonRpcId)` = request with ID
- `None` = explicit null ID or notification

JsonRpcResponse_NetworkRpcResult.description:
JSON-RPC 2.0 Response structure.

Represents a JSON-RPC response that can contain either a result or an error.

fee_bump.description:
Explicitly request fee-bump wrapper
Only valid when transaction_xdr contains a signed transaction

max_fee.description: Maximum fee in stroops (defaults to 0.1 XLM = 1,000,000 stroops)

transaction_xdr.description:
Pre-built transaction XDR (base64 encoded, signed or unsigned)
Mutually exclusive with operations field

WasmSource.description: Represents different ways to provide WASM code

tags.name: Relayers
tags.description: Relayers are the core components of the OpenZeppelin Relayer API. They are responsible for executing transactions on behalf of users and providing a secure and reliable way to interact with the blockchain.

tags.name: Plugins
tags.description: Plugins are TypeScript functions that can be used to extend the OpenZeppelin Relayer API functionality.

tags.name: Metrics
tags.description: Metrics are responsible for showing the metrics related to the relayers.

tags.name: Health
tags.description: Health is responsible for showing the health of the relayers.
